abstract: The Government Accountability Office had recommended that a $15 billion contract for rescue helicopters be reopened to competitors.
snippet: The Government Accountability Office had recommended that a $15 billion contract for rescue helicopters be reopened to competitors.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 20 (AP)  The Air Force will not reopen the $15 billion contract awarded to Boeing to build rescue helicopters. but will continue to talk to two rival companies that contested the contract.

headline.main: Air Force Says Boeing Will Keep Contract
headline.print_headline: Air Force Says Boeing Will Keep Contract
